Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a voluted nozzle with prominent volute-spines. The discus is decorated with two Erotes playing with a lion. Within the base-ring is the incised or impressed name FAVSTI. Light brown clay covered in a dark brown slip.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Sotheby's Sale Catalogue 25-27 April 1892, Lot 535.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1886)
Bailey 1965 / Lamps in the Victoria and Albert Museum (229)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
